element.tooltip: WorldInfo contains a title and persistent documentation or simple metadata information about an X3D scene. Hint: comments are not readable when a model file is loaded for viewing, but WorldInfo and Metadata* nodes are persistent and inspectable at run time. Hint: X3D for Web Authors, Chapter 15, Metadata Information https://x3dgraphics.com/examples/X3dForWebAuthors/Chapter15-Metadata/Chapter15-MetadataInformation.html
element.name: WorldInfo

attribute.tooltip: [DEF type ID #IMPLIED] DEF define uma identificação única para este nó, permitindo a outros nós o referenciá-lo. Dica: um DEF descritivo ajuda na clareza e na documentação. Hint: well-defined names can simplify design and debugging through improved author understanding. Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints, Naming Conventions https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#NamingConventions
attribute.name: DEF

attribute.tooltip: [USE type IDREF #IMPLIED] USE significa reusar um nó identificado por um DEF, ignorando _todos_ os outros atributos e filhos do nó. Dica: utilizando o USE para uma geometria (ao invés de duplica-la) pode melhorar o desempenho. Atenção: não inclua DEF (ou qualquer outro valor para um atributo) quando estiver usando o recurso do USE!
attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [title &inputOutputLabel; &SFStringLabel; #IMPLIED] title of this world, placed in window title. Dica: many XML tools substitute XML character references automatically if needed (such as & for & ampersand character, or " for " quotation-mark character).
attribute.name: title

attribute.tooltip: [info &inputOutputLabel; &MFStringLabel; #IMPLIED] Additional information about this model. Dica: Textos podem conter múltiplos valores, então separe cada texto usando aspas "https://www.web3d.org" "https://www.web3d.org/about" "etc." Dica: many XML tools substitute XML character references automatically if needed (such as & for & ampersand character, or " for " quotation-mark character).
attribute.name: info

attribute.tooltip: [containerField type NMTOKEN "children"] O containerField é um campo indicando a sua relação com o nó pai. Exemplos: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Shape. O atributo containerField é somente suportado em codificações XML de cenas X3D. Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints, containerField https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#containerField
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class type CDATA #IMPLIED] O atributo class é uma lista de classes separadas por espaços, reservada para o uso por XML stylesheets. O atributo class é somente suportado em codificações XML de cenas X3D.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: X3D is the top-most XML element for an Extensible 3D (X3D) Graphics model. The X3D element contains a single head element for metadata, and a single Scene element which is root node of the 3D scene graph. Dica: add or select a Scene tag to edit the scene graph. Hint: X3D Architecture 7.2.5.2 Header statement https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/core.html#HeaderStatement
element.name: X3D

attribute.tooltip: [version (3.0 | 3.1) #REQUIRED] X3D specification version for this scene, must be defined. Hint: use highest value matching schema and DOCTYPE in the scene. X3D version 3.0 standardization occurred in 2004.
attribute.name: version

attribute.tooltip: [profile type ENUMERATION #REQUIRED &profileNames;] profile attribute is required and defines the player or tool support needed for this model. Hint: Core profile corresponds to minimalist extensible profile with Metadata* nodes, useful for defining custom scene capabilities via addition of individual component statements. https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/coreprofile.html Hint: Interchange profile corresponds to minimum lightweight subset of nodes needed to display (or import/export) compelling 3D content. https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/interchange.html Hint: Interactive profile corresponds to Interchange geometry plus simple user interaction. https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/interactive.html Hint: Immersive profile is common and approximately matches VRML97 with Script and Prototypes. https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/immersive.html Hint: CADInterchange profile (X3D version 3.1 or later) corresponds to Interchange geometry plus distillation of computer-aided design (CAD) models. https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/CADInterchange.html Hint: Full profile contains all nodes defined in X3D specification. https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/fullProfile.html Warning: PROFILE is capitalized and is a separate statement in the ClassicVRML Encoding. Hint: X3D Architecture 7.2.5.3 PROFILE statement https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/core.html#PROFILEStatement
attribute.name: profile

attribute.tooltip: [xmlns:xsd type CDATA "http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"] XML namespace (xmlns) for XML Schema Definition (xsd). Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints, Validation of X3D Scenes using DTD and XML Schema https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#Validation
attribute.name: xmlns:xsd

attribute.tooltip: [xsd:noNamespaceSchemaLocation type CDATA "https://www.web3d.org/specifications/x3d-3.1.xsd"] url for the X3D Schema defining the X3D document-validation rules. Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints, Validation of X3D Scenes using DTD and XML Schema https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#Validation
attribute.name: xsd:noNamespaceSchemaLocation

element.tooltip: Comment can be used anywhere to make a scene clearer. Dica: only enter comments using this node, don't put comments into attribute values. Dica: VRML comments start with a # symbol and do not have to be retained by a browser. Dica: Use WorldInfo for persistent comments that must stay with a Scene.
element.name: XML_COMMENT

element.tooltip: TEXT (text data).
element.name: XML_TEXT

element.tooltip: CDATA (Character Data) Section Preserves literal character data verbatim. CDATA protects contained text from any XML substitutions. Dica: CDATA protects < and > operators in contained Script code. Dica: VRML comments start with a # symbol and do not have to be retained by a browser. Dica: Use WorldInfo for persistent comments that must stay with a Scene.
element.name: XML_CDATA

element.tooltip: Processing Instruction (PI) - Use it to pass directions and information to programs.
element.name: XML_PI

element.tooltip: Document Type Definition (DTD).
element.name: XML_DOCUMENT_TYPE

element.tooltip: EspduTransform is a networked Transform node that can contain most nodes. If activated, EspduTransform can send or receive Entity State Protocol Data Unit (PDU) packets using the IEEE Distributed Interactive Simulation (DIS) protocol. EspduTransform integrates functionality for the following DIS PDUs: EntityStatePdu, CollisionPdu, DetonatePdu, FirePdu, CreateEntity and RemoveEntity packets. Dica: insira um nó do tipo Shape antes de adicionar a geometria ou aparência. Hint: X3D for Advanced Modeling (X3D4AM) slideset https://x3dgraphics.com/slidesets/X3dForAdvancedModeling/DistributedInteractiveSimulation.pdf Warning: requires X3D profile='Full' or else include <component name='DIS' level='1'/>
element.name: EspduTransform

attribute.tooltip: [DEF type ID #IMPLIED] DEF define uma identificação única para este nó, permitindo a outros nós o referenciá-lo. Dica: um DEF descritivo ajuda na clareza e na documentação. Hint: well-defined names can simplify design and debugging through improved author understanding. Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints, Naming Conventions https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#NamingConventions
attribute.name: DEF

attribute.tooltip: [USE type IDREF #IMPLIED] USE significa reusar um nó identificado por um DEF, ignorando _todos_ os outros atributos e filhos do nó. Dica: utilizando o USE para uma geometria (ao invés de duplica-la) pode melhorar o desempenho. Atenção: não inclua DEF (ou qualquer outro valor para um atributo) quando estiver usando o recurso do USE!
attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [enabled &inputOutputLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] Liga/desliga a detecção de colisão para seus filhos e descendentes. Dica: antiga nomenclatura "collide" na especificação do VRML97.
attribute.name: enabled

attribute.tooltip: [marking &inputOutputLabel; &SFStringLabel; #IMPLIED] Maximum of 11 characters for simple entity label.
attribute.name: marking

attribute.tooltip: [siteID &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] siteID of the participating LAN or organization.
attribute.name: siteID

attribute.tooltip: [applicationID &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "1"] applicationID is unique for application at that site. Each simulation application that can respond to simulation management PDUs needs to have a unique applicationID.
attribute.name: applicationID

attribute.tooltip: [entityID &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] entityID is unique ID for entity within that application.
attribute.name: entityID

attribute.tooltip: [forceID &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] forceID determines the team membership of the issuing entity, and whether FRIENDLY OPPOSING or NEUTRAL or OTHER.
attribute.name: forceID

attribute.tooltip: [entityKind &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Integer enumerations value for whether entity is a PLATFORM, MUNITION, LIFE_FORM, ENVIRONMENTAL, CULTURAL_FEATURE, SUPPLY, RADIO, EXPENDABLE, SENSOR_EMITTER or OTHER.
attribute.name: entityKind

attribute.tooltip: [entityDomain &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Integer enumerations value for domain in which the entity operates: LAND, AIR, SURFACE, SUBSURFACE, SPACE or OTHER.
attribute.name: entityDomain

attribute.tooltip: [entityCountry &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Integer enumerations value for country to which the design of the entity or its design specification is attributed.
attribute.name: entityCountry

attribute.tooltip: [entityCategory &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Integer enumerations value for main category that describes the entity, semantics of each code varies according to domain. See DIS Enumerations values.
attribute.name: entityCategory

attribute.tooltip: [entitySubCategory &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Integer enumerations value for particular subcategory to which an entity belongs based on the Category field. See DIS Enumerations values.
attribute.name: entitySubCategory

attribute.tooltip: [entitySpecific &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Specific information about an entity based on the Subcategory field. See DIS Enumerations values.
attribute.name: entitySpecific

attribute.tooltip: [entityExtra &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Any extra information required to describe a particular entity. The contents of this field shall depend on the type of entity represented.
attribute.name: entityExtra

attribute.tooltip: [readInterval &inputOutputLabel; &SFTimeLabel; "0.1"] [0,+∞) Seconds between read updates, 0 means no reading. Hint: readInterval is a nonnegative SFTime duration interval, not an absolute clock time.
attribute.name: readInterval

attribute.tooltip: [writeInterval &inputOutputLabel; &SFTimeLabel; "1.0"] [0,+∞) Seconds between write updates, 0 means no writing (sending). Hint: writeInterval is a nonnegative SFTime duration interval, not an absolute clock time.
attribute.name: writeInterval

attribute.tooltip: [networkMode &inputOutputLabel; &SFStringLabel; &DisNetworkModeValues; standAlone] Whether this entity is ignoring the network, sending DIS packets to the network, or receiving DIS packets from the network. (1) standAlone: ignore network but still respond to events in local scene. (2) networkReader: listen to network and read PDU packets at readInterval, act as remote copy of entity. (3) networkWriter: send PDU packets to network at writeInterval, act as master entity. Default value "standAlone" ensures that DIS network activation within a scene as networkReader or networkWriter is intentional. Warning: do not wrap extra quotation marks around these SFString enumeration values, since "quotation" "marks" are only used for MFString values.
attribute.name: networkMode

attribute.tooltip: [isStandAlone &outputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] Whether networkMode="local" (ignore network but still respond to local events) Warning: it is an error to define this transient outputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a source for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: isStandAlone

attribute.tooltip: [isNetworkReader &outputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] Whether networkMode="remote" (listen to network as copy of remote entity) Warning: it is an error to define this transient outputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a source for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: isNetworkReader

attribute.tooltip: [isNetworkWriter &outputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] Whether networkMode="master" (output to network as master entity at writeInterval) Warning: it is an error to define this transient outputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a source for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: isNetworkWriter

attribute.tooltip: [address &inputOutputLabel; &SFStringLabel; localhost] Multicast network address, or else "localhost" Example: 224.2.181.145.
attribute.name: address

attribute.tooltip: [port &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Network connection port number (EXAMPLE 3000) for sending or receiving DIS messages. Example: 3000.
attribute.name: port

attribute.tooltip: [multicastRelayHost &inputOutputLabel; &SFStringLabel; #IMPLIED] Fallback server address if multicast not available locally. Example: track.nps.edu.
attribute.name: multicastRelayHost

attribute.tooltip: [multicastRelayPort &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Fallback server port if multicast not available locally. Example: 8010.
attribute.name: multicastRelayPort

attribute.tooltip: [rtpHeaderExpected &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "false"] Whether RTP headers are prepended to DIS PDUs.
attribute.name: rtpHeaderExpected

attribute.tooltip: [isRtpHeaderHeard &outputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] Whether incoming DIS packets have an RTP header prepended. Warning: it is an error to define this transient outputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a source for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: isRtpHeaderHeard

attribute.tooltip: [isActive &outputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] Have we received a network update recently? Warning: it is an error to define this transient outputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a source for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: isActive

attribute.tooltip: [timestamp &outputOnlyLabel; &SFTimeLabel; #FIXED ""] DIS timestamp received from latest PDU update, converted to X3D SFTime units. Warning: it is an error to define this transient outputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a source for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: timestamp

attribute.tooltip: [translation &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"] Position of children relative to local coordinate system, usually read from (or written to) remote, networked EspduTransform nodes.
attribute.name: translation

attribute.tooltip: [rotation &inputOutputLabel; &SFRotationLabel; "0 0 1 0"] Orientation of children relative to local coordinate system, usually read from (or written to) remote, networked EspduTransform nodes.
attribute.name: rotation

attribute.tooltip: [center &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"] Translation offset from origin of local coordinate system.
attribute.name: center

attribute.tooltip: [scale &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "1 1 1"] Non-uniform x-y-z scale of child coordinate system, adjusted by center and scaleOrientation.
attribute.name: scale

attribute.tooltip: [scaleOrientation &inputOutputLabel; &SFRotationLabel; "0 0 1 0"] Preliminary rotation of coordinate system before scaling (to allow scaling around arbitrary orientations).
attribute.name: scaleOrientation

attribute.tooltip: [bboxCenter &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"] Centro do cubo limitante : deslocamento da posição original do sistema de coordenadas. Hint: precomputation and inclusion of bounding box information can speed up the initialization of large detailed models, with a corresponding cost of increased file size. Hint: X3D Architecture, 10.2.2 Bounding boxes https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/group.html#BoundingBoxes
attribute.name: bboxCenter

attribute.tooltip: [bboxSize &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "-1 -1 -1"] Tamanho do cubo limitante : automaticamente calculado, pode ser especificado para uma otimização ou limitação. Hint: precomputation and inclusion of bounding box information can speed up the initialization of large detailed models, with a corresponding cost of increased file size. Hint: X3D Architecture, 10.2.2 Bounding boxes https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/group.html#BoundingBoxes
attribute.name: bboxSize

attribute.tooltip: [linearVelocity &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"]Velocity of the entity relative to the rotating Earth in either world or entity coordinates, depending on the dead reckoning algorithm used.
attribute.name: linearVelocity

attribute.tooltip: [linearAcceleration &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"] Acceleration of the entity relative to the rotating Earth in either world or entity coordinates, depending on the dead reckoning algorithm used.
attribute.name: linearAcceleration

attribute.tooltip: [deadReckoning &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Dead reckoning algorithm being used to project position/orientation with velocities/accelerations.
attribute.name: deadReckoning

attribute.tooltip: [isCollided &outputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] Has a matching CollisionPDU reported a collision? Warning: it is an error to define this transient outputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a source for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: isCollided

attribute.tooltip: [collideTime &outputOnlyLabel; &SFTimeLabel; #FIXED ""] When were we collided with? Warning: it is an error to define this transient outputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a source for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: collideTime

attribute.tooltip: [isDetonated &outputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] Has a matching DetonationPDU reported a detonation? Warning: it is an error to define this transient outputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a source for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: isDetonated

attribute.tooltip: [detonateTime &outputOnlyLabel; &SFTimeLabel; #FIXED ""] When were we detonated?
attribute.name: detonateTime

attribute.tooltip: [fired1 &inputOutputLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "false"] Has the primary weapon (Fire PDU) been fired?
attribute.name: fired1

attribute.tooltip: [fired2 &inputOutputLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "false"] Has the secondary weapon (Fire PDU) been fired?
attribute.name: fired2

attribute.tooltip: [firedTime &outputOnlyLabel; &SFTimeLabel; #FIXED ""] When did we shoot a weapon (Fire PDU)? Warning: it is an error to define this transient outputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a source for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: firedTime

attribute.tooltip: [munitionStartPoint &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"] Initial point of the munition path from firing weapon to detonation or impact, in exercise coordinates.
attribute.name: munitionStartPoint

attribute.tooltip: [munitionEndPoint &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"] Final point of the munition path from firing weapon to detonation or impact, in exercise coordinates.
attribute.name: munitionEndPoint

attribute.tooltip: [munitionSiteID &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Munition siteID of the participating LAN or organization.
attribute.name: munitionSiteID

attribute.tooltip: [munitionApplicationID &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "1"] munitionApplicationID, unique for application at that site. Each simulation application that can respond to simulation management PDUs needs to have a unique applicationID.
attribute.name: munitionApplicationID

attribute.tooltip: [munitionEntityID &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] munitionEntityID is unique ID for entity firing munition within that application.
attribute.name: munitionEntityID

attribute.tooltip: [fireMissionIndex &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; #FIXED ""]
attribute.name: fireMissionIndex

attribute.tooltip: [warhead &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Integer enumerations value for type of warhead on the munition.
attribute.name: warhead

attribute.tooltip: [fuse &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Integer enumerations value for type of fuse on the munition.
attribute.name: fuse

attribute.tooltip: [munitionQuantity &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Quantity of munitions fired.
attribute.name: munitionQuantity

attribute.tooltip: [firingRate &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Rate at which munitions are fired.
attribute.name: firingRate

attribute.tooltip: [firingRange &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "0"] Range (three dimension, straight-line distance) that the firing entity's fire control system has assumed for computing the fire control solution if a weapon and if the value is known
attribute.name: firingRange

attribute.tooltip: [collisionType &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Integer enumeration for type of collision: ELASTIC or INELASTIC.
attribute.name: collisionType

attribute.tooltip: [detonationLocation &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"] World coordinates for detonationLocation
attribute.name: detonationLocation

attribute.tooltip: [detonationRelativeLocation &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"] Relative coordinates for detonation location
attribute.name: detonationRelativeLocation

attribute.tooltip: [detonationResult &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Integer enumeration for type of detonation and result that occurred., if any.
attribute.name: detonationResult

attribute.tooltip: [eventApplicationID &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "1"]Simulation/exercise eventApplicationID is unique for events generated from application at that site. Each simulation application that can respond to simulation management PDUs needs to have a unique applicationID.
attribute.name: eventApplicationID

attribute.tooltip: [eventEntityID &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] For a given event, simulation/exercise entityID is a unique ID for a single entity within that application.
attribute.name: eventEntityID

attribute.tooltip: [eventNumber &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Sequential number of each event issued by an application. Warning: reuse of numbers may be necessary during long simulation exercises.
attribute.name: eventNumber

attribute.tooltip: [eventSiteID &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Simulation/exercise siteID of the participating LAN or organization.
attribute.name: eventSiteID

attribute.tooltip: [articulationParameterCount &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Number of articulated parameters attached to this entity state PDU.
attribute.name: articulationParameterCount

attribute.tooltip: [articulationParameterDesignatorArray &inputOutputLabel; &MFInt32Label; #IMPLIED] Array of designators for each articulated parameter.
attribute.name: articulationParameterDesignatorArray

attribute.tooltip: [articulationParameterChangeIndicatorArray &inputOutputLabel; &MFInt32Label; #IMPLIED] Array of change counters, each incremented when an articulated parameter is updated.#IMPLIED]
attribute.name: articulationParameterChangeIndicatorArray

attribute.tooltip: [articulationParameterIdPartAttachedToArray &inputOutputLabel; &MFInt32Label; #IMPLIED] Array of ID parts that each articulated parameter is attached to.
attribute.name: articulationParameterIdPartAttachedToArray

attribute.tooltip: [articulationParameterTypeArray &inputOutputLabel; &MFInt32Label; #IMPLIED] Array of type enumerations for each articulated parameter element.
attribute.name: articulationParameterTypeArray

attribute.tooltip: [articulationParameterArray &inputOutputLabel; &MFFloatLabel; #IMPLIED] Information required for representation of the entity's visual appearance and position of its articulated parts. Hint: renamed as Variable Parameter in IEEE DIS 2012 revised standard.
attribute.name: articulationParameterArray

attribute.tooltip: [set_articulationParameterValue0 &inputOnlyLabel; &SFFloatLabel; #FIXED ""] Set element of user-defined payload array. Warning: it is an error to define this transient inputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a destination for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: set_articulationParameterValue0

attribute.tooltip: [set_articulationParameterValue1 &inputOnlyLabel; &SFFloatLabel; #FIXED ""] Set element of user-defined payload array. Warning: it is an error to define this transient inputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a destination for ROUTE events.

attribute.tooltip: [geoSystem &initializeOnlyLabel; &GeoSystemType;] Identifies spatial reference frame: Geodetic (GD), Geocentric (GC), Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM). Supported values: "GD" "UTM" or "GC" followed by additional quoted string parameters as appropriate for the type. Hint: X3D Architecture 25.2.2 Spatial reference frames https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/geodata.html#Spatialreferenceframes Hint: X3D Architecture 25.2.4 Specifying geospatial coordinates https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/geodata.html#Specifyinggeospatialcoords Hint: UTM is Universal Transverse Mercator coordinate system https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universal_Transverse_Mercator_coordinate_system Warning: deprecated values are GDC (replaced by GD) and GCC (replaced by GC).
attribute.name: geoSystem

attribute.tooltip: [geoCoords &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec3dLabel; "0 0 0"] Geographic location (specified in current geoSystem coordinates) for children geometry (specified in relative coordinate system, in meters). Hint: X3D for Advanced Modeling (X3D4AM) slideset https://x3dgraphics.com/slidesets/X3dForAdvancedModeling/GeospatialComponentX3dEarth.pdf Warning: requires X3D profile='Full' or else include <component name='Geospatial' level='1'/>
attribute.name: geoCoords

attribute.tooltip: [containerField type NMTOKEN "children"] O containerField é um campo indicando a sua relação com o nó pai. Exemplos: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Shape. O atributo containerField é somente suportado em codificações XML de cenas X3D. Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints, containerField https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#containerField
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class type CDATA #IMPLIED] O atributo class é uma lista de classes separadas por espaços, reservada para o uso por XML stylesheets. O atributo class é somente suportado em codificações XML de cenas X3D.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: ReceiverPdu is a networked Protocol Data Unit (PDU) information node that transmits the state of radio frequency (RF) receivers modeled in a simulation. Hint: ReceiverPdu packets use the IEEE Distributed Interactive Simulation (DIS) protocol. Hint: Savage Developers Guide on DIS https://savage.nps.edu/Savage/developers.html#DIS Hint: X3D for Advanced Modeling (X3D4AM) slideset https://x3dgraphics.com/slidesets/X3dForAdvancedModeling/DistributedInteractiveSimulation.pdf Warning: requires X3D profile='Full' or else include <component name='DIS' level='1'/>
element.name: ReceiverPdu

attribute.tooltip: [DEF type ID #IMPLIED] DEF define uma identificação única para este nó, permitindo a outros nós o referenciá-lo. Dica: um DEF descritivo ajuda na clareza e na documentação. Hint: well-defined names can simplify design and debugging through improved author understanding. Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints, Naming Conventions https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#NamingConventions
attribute.name: DEF

attribute.tooltip: [USE type IDREF #IMPLIED] USE significa reusar um nó identificado por um DEF, ignorando _todos_ os outros atributos e filhos do nó. Dica: utilizando o USE para uma geometria (ao invés de duplica-la) pode melhorar o desempenho. Atenção: não inclua DEF (ou qualquer outro valor para um atributo) quando estiver usando o recurso do USE!
attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [enabled &inputOutputLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] Liga/desliga a detecção de colisão para seus filhos e descendentes. Dica: antiga nomenclatura "collide" na especificação do VRML97.
attribute.name: enabled

attribute.tooltip: [whichGeometry &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "1"] Select geometry to render: -1 for no geometry, 0 for text trace, 1 for default geometry, (optional) higher values to render different states.
attribute.name: whichGeometry

attribute.tooltip: [bboxCenter &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"] Centro do cubo limitante : deslocamento da posição original do sistema de coordenadas. Hint: precomputation and inclusion of bounding box information can speed up the initialization of large detailed models, with a corresponding cost of increased file size. Hint: X3D Architecture, 10.2.2 Bounding boxes https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/group.html#BoundingBoxes
attribute.name: bboxCenter

attribute.tooltip: [bboxSize &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "-1 -1 -1"] Tamanho do cubo limitante : automaticamente calculado, pode ser especificado para uma otimização ou limitação. Hint: precomputation and inclusion of bounding box information can speed up the initialization of large detailed models, with a corresponding cost of increased file size. Hint: X3D Architecture, 10.2.2 Bounding boxes https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/group.html#BoundingBoxes
attribute.name: bboxSize

attribute.tooltip: [siteID &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Simulation/exercise siteID of the participating LAN or organization.
attribute.name: siteID

attribute.tooltip: [applicationID &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "1"] Each simulation application that can respond to simulation management PDUs needs to have a unique applicationID.
attribute.name: applicationID

attribute.tooltip: [entityID &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] EntityID unique ID for entity within that application.
attribute.name: entityID

attribute.tooltip: [readInterval &inputOutputLabel; &SFTimeLabel; "0.1"] [0,+∞) Seconds between read updates, 0 means no reading. Hint: readInterval is a nonnegative SFTime duration interval, not an absolute clock time.
attribute.name: readInterval

attribute.tooltip: [writeInterval &inputOutputLabel; &SFTimeLabel; "1.0"] [0,+∞) Seconds between write updates, 0 means no writing (sending). Hint: writeInterval is a nonnegative SFTime duration interval, not an absolute clock time.
attribute.name: writeInterval

attribute.tooltip: [networkMode &inputOutputLabel; &SFStringLabel; &DisNetworkModeValues; standAlone] Whether this entity is ignoring the network, sending DIS packets to the network, or receiving DIS packets from the network. (1) standAlone: ignore network but still respond to events in local scene. (2) networkReader: listen to network and read PDU packets at readInterval, act as remote copy of entity. (3) networkWriter: send PDU packets to network at writeInterval, act as master entity. Default value "standAlone" ensures that DIS network activation within a scene as networkReader or networkWriter is intentional. Warning: do not wrap extra quotation marks around these SFString enumeration values, since "quotation" "marks" are only used for MFString values.
attribute.name: networkMode

attribute.tooltip: [isStandAlone &outputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] Whether networkMode="local" (ignore network but still respond to local events) Warning: it is an error to define this transient outputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a source for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: isStandAlone

attribute.tooltip: [isNetworkReader &outputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] Whether networkMode="remote" (listen to network as copy of remote entity) Warning: it is an error to define this transient outputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a source for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: isNetworkReader

attribute.tooltip: [isNetworkWriter &outputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] Whether networkMode="master" (output to network as master entity at writeInterval) Warning: it is an error to define this transient outputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a source for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: isNetworkWriter

attribute.tooltip: [address &inputOutputLabel; &SFStringLabel; localhost] Multicast network address, or else "localhost" Example: 224.2.181.145.
attribute.name: address

attribute.tooltip: [port &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Multicast network port, for example: 3000.
attribute.name: port

attribute.tooltip: [multicastRelayHost &inputOutputLabel; &SFStringLabel; #IMPLIED] Fallback server address if multicast not available locally. For example: track.nps.edu.
attribute.name: multicastRelayHost

attribute.tooltip: [multicastRelayPort &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Fallback server port if multicast not available locally. For example: 8010.
attribute.name: multicastRelayPort

attribute.tooltip: [rtpHeaderExpected &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "false"] Whether RTP headers are prepended to DIS PDUs.
attribute.name: rtpHeaderExpected

attribute.tooltip: [isRtpHeaderHeard &outputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] Whether incoming DIS packets have an RTP header prepended. Warning: it is an error to define this transient outputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a source for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: isRtpHeaderHeard

attribute.tooltip: [isActive &outputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] Have we had a network update recently?. Warning: it is an error to define this transient outputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a source for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: isActive

attribute.tooltip: [timestamp &outputOnlyLabel; &SFTimeLabel; #FIXED ""] DIS timestamp in X3D units (value 0.0 matches 1 January 1970) in seconds. Warning: it is an error to define this transient outputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a source for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: timestamp

attribute.tooltip: [radioID &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Identifies a particular radio within a given entity.
attribute.name: radioID

attribute.tooltip: [receivedPower &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "0"] receivedPower indicates radio frequency (RF) power received, in units of decibel-milliwatts (dBm), after applying any propagation loss and antenna gain
attribute.name: receivedPower

attribute.tooltip: [receiverState &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] receiverState indicates if receiver is currently idle or busy via one of these enumerated values: 0 = off, 1 = on but not receiving, or 2 = on and receiving.
attribute.name: receiverState

attribute.tooltip: [transmitterSiteID &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Simulation/exercise transmitterSiteID of the participating LAN or organization.
attribute.name: transmitterSiteID

attribute.tooltip: [transmitterApplicationID &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"]Simulation/exercise transmitterApplicationID is unique for transmitter application at that site. Each simulation application that can respond to simulation management PDUs needs to have a unique applicationID.
attribute.name: transmitterApplicationID

attribute.tooltip: [transmitterEntityID &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Simulation/exercise transmitterEntityID is a unique ID for a single entity within that application.
attribute.name: transmitterEntityID

attribute.tooltip: [transmitterRadioID &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Identifies a particular radio within a given entity.

attribute.tooltip: [radioID &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Identifies a particular radio within a given entity.
attribute.name: radioID

attribute.tooltip: [encodingScheme &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] designates both Encoding Class and Encoding Type. Encoding Class enumerated value (2 most significant bits): 0 = Encoded Voice; 1 = Raw Binary Data; 2 = Application-Specific Data; 3 = Database Index. Encoding Type enumerated value (14 least significant bits): 1 = 8-bit mu-law; 2 = CVSD per MIL-STD-188-113; 3 = ADPCM per CCITT G.721; 4 = 16-bit linear PCM; 5 = 8-bit linear PCM; 6 = Vector Quantization.
attribute.name: encodingScheme

attribute.tooltip: [tdlType &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Tactical Data Link (TDL) type as an enumerated value when the Encoding Class is voice, raw binary, application-specific, or database index representation of a TDL message.
attribute.name: tdlType

attribute.tooltip: [sampleRate &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] sampleRate gives either (1) sample rate in samples per second if Encoding Class is encoded audio, or (2) data rate in bits per second for data transmissions. If Encoding Class is database index, sampleRate is set to zero.
attribute.name: sampleRate

attribute.tooltip: [samples &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Number of samples in the PDU if the Encoding Class is encoded voice, otherwise the field is set to zero.
attribute.name: samples

attribute.tooltip: [dataLength &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] number of bits of digital voice audio or digital data being sent in the Signal PDU. If the Encoding Class is database index, then dataLength field is set to 96.
attribute.name: dataLength

attribute.tooltip: [data &inputOutputLabel; &MFInt32Label; #IMPLIED] Holds audio or digital data conveyed by the radio transmission. Interpretation of the field depends on values of encodingScheme and tdlType fields.
attribute.name: data

attribute.tooltip: [isNetworkReader &outputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] Whether networkMode="remote" (listen to network as copy of remote entity) Warning: it is an error to define this transient outputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a source for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: isNetworkReader

attribute.tooltip: [isNetworkWriter &outputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] Whether networkMode="master" (output to network as master entity at writeInterval) Warning: it is an error to define this transient outputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a source for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: isNetworkWriter

attribute.tooltip: [address &inputOutputLabel; &SFStringLabel; localhost] Multicast network address, or else "localhost" example: 224.2.181.145.
attribute.name: address

attribute.tooltip: [port &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Multicast network port, for example: 3000.
attribute.name: port

attribute.tooltip: [multicastRelayHost &inputOutputLabel; &SFStringLabel; #IMPLIED] Fallback server address if multicast not available locally. For example: track.nps.edu.
attribute.name: multicastRelayHost

attribute.tooltip: [multicastRelayPort &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Fallback server port if multicast not available locally. For example: 8010.
attribute.name: multicastRelayPort

attribute.tooltip: [rtpHeaderExpected &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "false"] Whether RTP headers are prepended to DIS PDUs.
attribute.name: rtpHeaderExpected

attribute.tooltip: [isRtpHeaderHeard &outputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] Whether incoming DIS packets have an RTP header prepended. Warning: it is an error to define this transient outputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a source for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: isRtpHeaderHeard

attribute.tooltip: [isActive &outputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] Have we had a network update recently?. Warning: it is an error to define this transient outputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a source for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: isActive

attribute.tooltip: [timestamp &outputOnlyLabel; &SFTimeLabel; #FIXED ""] DIS timestamp in X3D units (value 0.0 matches 1 January 1970) in seconds. Warning: it is an error to define this transient outputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a source for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: timestamp

attribute.tooltip: [radioID &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Identifies a particular radio within a given entity.
attribute.name: radioID

attribute.tooltip: [antennaLocation &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"] World coordinates for antenna location.
attribute.name: antennaLocation

attribute.tooltip: [relativeAntennaLocation &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"] Relative coordinates for antenna location.
attribute.name: relativeAntennaLocation

attribute.tooltip: [antennaPatternLength &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"]
attribute.name: antennaPatternLength

attribute.tooltip: [antennaPatternType &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Antenna shape pattern: 0 for omnidirectional, 1 for beam, 2 for spherical harmonic (deprecated), or optional higher value
attribute.name: antennaPatternType

attribute.tooltip: [cryptoKeyID &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Nonzero value corresponding to the simulated cryptographic key. Enumerations value 0 indicates plain (unencrypted) communications.
attribute.name: cryptoKeyID

attribute.tooltip: [cryptoSystem &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Indicates type of crypto system being used, even if the encryption equipment is not keyed. Value 0 for No Encryption Device, higher enumerations values correspond to other specific equipment..
attribute.name: cryptoSystem

attribute.tooltip: [frequency &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Transmission frequency in Hz. If the radio is in frequency hopping mode, this field may be set to the center of the frequency hopping band currently in use, or to some other appropriate value.
attribute.name: frequency

attribute.tooltip: [inputSource &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Source of transmission input. Enumerations value 0 for Other, 1 for Pilot, 2 for Copilot, 3 for First Officer, 4 for Driver, 5 for Loader, 6 for Gunner, 7 for Commander, 8 for Digital Data Device, 9 for Intercom, 10 for Audio Jammer, 11 for Data Jammer, 12 for GPS Jammer, 13 for GPS Meaconer (masking beacon).
attribute.name: inputSource

attribute.tooltip: [lengthOfModulationParameters &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"]
attribute.name: lengthOfModulationParameters

attribute.tooltip: [modulationTypeDetail &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Integer enumeration containing detailed information depending on the major modulation type.
attribute.name: modulationTypeDetail

attribute.tooltip: [modulationTypeMajor &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Integer enumeration containing major classification of the modulation type. Enumerations value 0 for No Statement, 1 for Amplitude, 2 for Amplitude and Angle, 3 for Angle, 4 for Combination, 5 for Pulse, 6 for Unmodulated, 7 for Carrier Phase Shift Modulation (CPSM).
attribute.name: modulationTypeMajor

attribute.tooltip: [modulationTypeSpreadSpectrum &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Indicates the spread spectrum technique or combination of spread spectrum techniques in use.
attribute.name: modulationTypeSpreadSpectrum

attribute.tooltip: [modulationTypeSystem &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Specifies radio system associated with this Transmitter PDU and used to interpret other fields whose values depend on a specific radio system.
attribute.name: modulationTypeSystem

attribute.tooltip: [power &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "0"] Power that radio would be capable of outputting if on and transmitting, independent of actual transmit state of the radio.
attribute.name: power

attribute.tooltip: [radioEntityTypeCategory &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Integer enumeration containing EntityType of transmitter radio. Enumerations value: 0 for Other, 1 for Generic Radio or Simple Intercom, 2 for HAVE QUICK, 3 for HAVE QUICK II, 4 for HAVE QUICK IIA, 5 for SINCGARS, 6 for CCTT SINCGARS, 7 for EPLRS (Enhanced Position Location Reporting System), 8 for JTIDS/MIDS, 9 for Link 11, 10 for Link 11B, 11 for L-Band SATCOM, 12 for Enhanced SINCGARS 7.3, 13 for Navigation Aid.
attribute.name: radioEntityTypeCategory

attribute.tooltip: [radioEntityTypeCountry &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Integer enumerations value for country to which the design of the entity or its design specification is attributed.
attribute.name: radioEntityTypeCountry

attribute.tooltip: [radioEntityTypeDomain &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Integer enumerations value for domain in which the entity operates: LAND, AIR, SURFACE, SUBSURFACE, SPACE or OTHER.
attribute.name: radioEntityTypeDomain

attribute.tooltip: [radioEntityTypeKind &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Integer enumerations value for whether entity is a PLATFORM, MUNITION, LIFE_FORM, ENVIRONMENTAL, CULTURAL_FEATURE, SUPPLY, RADIO, EXPENDABLE, SENSOR_EMITTER or OTHER.
attribute.name: radioEntityTypeKind

attribute.tooltip: [radioEntityTypeNomenclature &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Integer enumerations value indicating nomenclature (name) for a particular emitter. See DIS enumerations reference for value/name pairs.
attribute.name: radioEntityTypeNomenclature

attribute.tooltip: [radioEntityTypeNomenclatureVersion &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Named equipment version number.
attribute.name: radioEntityTypeNomenclatureVersion

attribute.tooltip: [transmitFrequencyBandwidth &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "0.0"] Bandwidth of the particular transmitter measured between the half-power (-3 dB) points (this value represents total bandwidth, not the deviation from the center frequency).
attribute.name: transmitFrequencyBandwidth

attribute.tooltip: [transmitState &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"] Specify radio transmission state where enumerations value 0 is for off, value 1 for powered but not transmitting, or value 1 is for powered and transmitting,
attribute.name: transmitState

attribute.tooltip: [geoSystem &initializeOnlyLabel; &GeoSystemType;] Identifies spatial reference frame: Geodetic (GD), Geocentric (GC), Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM). Supported values: "GD" "UTM" or "GC" followed by additional quoted string parameters as appropriate for the type. Hint: X3D Architecture 25.2.2 Spatial reference frames https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/geodata.html#Spatialreferenceframes Hint: X3D Architecture 25.2.4 Specifying geospatial coordinates https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/geodata.html#Specifyinggeospatialcoords Hint: UTM is Universal Transverse Mercator coordinate system https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universal_Transverse_Mercator_coordinate_system Warning: deprecated values are GDC (replaced by GD) and GCC (replaced by GC).
attribute.name: geoSystem

attribute.tooltip: [geoCoords &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec3dLabel; "0 0 0"] Geographic location (specified in current geoSystem coordinates) for children geometry (specified in relative coordinate system, in meters). Hint: X3D for Advanced Modeling (X3D4AM) slideset https://x3dgraphics.com/slidesets/X3dForAdvancedModeling/GeospatialComponentX3dEarth.pdf Warning: requires X3D profile='Full' or else include <component name='Geospatial' level='1'/>
attribute.name: geoCoords

attribute.tooltip: [containerField type NMTOKEN "children"] O containerField é um campo indicando a sua relação com o nó pai. Exemplos: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Shape. O atributo containerField é somente suportado em codificações XML de cenas X3D. Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints, containerField https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#containerField
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class type CDATA #IMPLIED] O atributo class é uma lista de classes separadas por espaços, reservada para o uso por XML stylesheets. O atributo class é somente suportado em codificações XML de cenas X3D.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: GeoCoordinate builds geometry as a set of geographic 3D coordinates. These are transformed into a geocentric, curved-earth representation. GeoCoordinate is only used by IndexedFaceSet, IndexedLineSet, LineSet and PointSet. GeoCoordinate can contain a GeoOrigin node. Hint: X3D for Advanced Modeling (X3D4AM) slideset https://x3dgraphics.com/slidesets/X3dForAdvancedModeling/GeospatialComponentX3dEarth.pdf Warning: requires X3D profile='Full' or else include <component name='Geospatial' level='1'/>
element.name: GeoCoordinate

attribute.tooltip: [DEF type ID #IMPLIED] DEF define uma identificação única para este nó, permitindo a outros nós o referenciá-lo. Dica: um DEF descritivo ajuda na clareza e na documentação. Hint: well-defined names can simplify design and debugging through improved author understanding. Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints, Naming Conventions https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#NamingConventions
attribute.name: DEF

attribute.tooltip: [USE type IDREF #IMPLIED] USE significa reusar um nó identificado por um DEF, ignorando _todos_ os outros atributos e filhos do nó. Dica: utilizando o USE para uma geometria (ao invés de duplica-la) pode melhorar o desempenho. Atenção: não inclua DEF (ou qualquer outro valor para um atributo) quando estiver usando o recurso do USE!
attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [geoSystem &initializeOnlyLabel; &GeoSystemType;] Identifies spatial reference frame: Geodetic (GD), Geocentric (GC), Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM). Supported values: "GD" "UTM" or "GC" followed by additional quoted string parameters as appropriate for the type. Hint: X3D Architecture 25.2.2 Spatial reference frames https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/geodata.html#Spatialreferenceframes Hint: X3D Architecture 25.2.4 Specifying geospatial coordinates https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/geodata.html#Specifyinggeospatialcoords Hint: UTM is Universal Transverse Mercator coordinate system https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universal_Transverse_Mercator_coordinate_system Warning: deprecated values are GDC (replaced by GD) and GCC (replaced by GC).
attribute.name: geoSystem

attribute.tooltip: [point &inputOutputLabel; &MFVec3dLabel; #IMPLIED] point contains a set of actual 3D geographic coordinates, provided in geoSystem format can split strings if desired: "x1 y1 z1 x2 y2 z2" or "x1 y1 z1", "x2 y2 z2"
attribute.name: point

attribute.tooltip: [containerField type NMTOKEN "coord"] O containerField é um campo indicando a sua relação com o nó pai. Exemplos: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Shape. O atributo containerField é somente suportado em codificações XML de cenas X3D. Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints, containerField https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#containerField
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class type CDATA #IMPLIED] O atributo class é uma lista de classes separadas por espaços, reservada para o uso por XML stylesheets. O atributo class é somente suportado em codificações XML de cenas X3D.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: GeoElevationGrid é um nó geométrico, defining a rectangular height field above or below a curved geographic surface using geographic coordinates. Hint: the height array defines (xDimension-1)*(zDimension-1) quadrilaterals. Warning: generated quadrilaterals can be nonplanar. Tessellation splits quadrilaterals into triangles along seam starting at initial vertex of the quadrilateral and proceeding to opposite vertex. Hint: positive direction for normal of each triangle is on same side of the quadrilateral. Triangles are defined either counterclockwise or clockwise depending on value of ccw field. Hint: GeoElevationGrid can contain GeoOrigin, Color|ColorRGBA, Normal and TextureCoordinate nodes. Dica: insira um nó do tipo Shape antes de adicionar a geometria ou aparência. Hint: X3D for Advanced Modeling (X3D4AM) slideset https://x3dgraphics.com/slidesets/X3dForAdvancedModeling/GeospatialComponentX3dEarth.pdf Warning: requires X3D profile='Full' or else include <component name='Geospatial' level='1'/> Warning: avoid having GeoLocation or GeoTransform as a parent or ancestor node of GeoElevationGrid, since multiple geospatial transformations then occur with unpredictable results.
element.name: GeoElevationGrid

attribute.tooltip: [DEF type ID #IMPLIED] DEF define uma identificação única para este nó, permitindo a outros nós o referenciá-lo. Dica: um DEF descritivo ajuda na clareza e na documentação. Hint: well-defined names can simplify design and debugging through improved author understanding. Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints, Naming Conventions https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#NamingConventions
attribute.name: DEF

attribute.tooltip: [USE type IDREF #IMPLIED] USE significa reusar um nó identificado por um DEF, ignorando _todos_ os outros atributos e filhos do nó. Dica: utilizando o USE para uma geometria (ao invés de duplica-la) pode melhorar o desempenho. Atenção: não inclua DEF (ou qualquer outro valor para um atributo) quando estiver usando o recurso do USE!
attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [geoSystem &initializeOnlyLabel; &GeoSystemType;] Identifies spatial reference frame: Geodetic (GD), Geocentric (GC), Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM). Supported values: "GD" "UTM" or "GC" followed by additional quoted string parameters as appropriate for the type. Hint: X3D Architecture 25.2.2 Spatial reference frames https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/geodata.html#Spatialreferenceframes Hint: X3D Architecture 25.2.4 Specifying geospatial coordinates https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/geodata.html#Specifyinggeospatialcoords Hint: UTM is Universal Transverse Mercator coordinate system https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universal_Transverse_Mercator_coordinate_system Warning: deprecated values are GDC (replaced by GD) and GCC (replaced by GC).
attribute.name: geoSystem

attribute.tooltip: [geoGridOrigin &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFVec3dLabel; "0 0 0"] Geographic coordinate for southwest (lower-left) corner of height dataset.
attribute.name: geoGridOrigin

attribute.tooltip: [xDimension &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFInt32Label; "2"] [0,+∞) Number of elements in the height array along east-west X direction. Dica: total horizontal x-axis distance equals (xDimension-1) * xSpacing. Warning: xDimension < 2 means that ElevationGrid contains no quadrilaterals.
attribute.name: xDimension

attribute.tooltip: [zDimension &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFInt32Label; "2"] [0,+∞) Number of elements in the height array along north-south Z direction. Dica: total lateral z-axis distance equals (zDimension-1) * zSpacing. Warning: zDimension < 2 means that ElevationGrid contains no quadrilaterals.
attribute.name: zDimension

attribute.tooltip: [xSpacing &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFDoubleLabel; "1.0"] (0,+∞) Distance between grid-array vertices along east-west X direction. Hint: when geoSystem is GDC, xSpacing is number of degrees of longitude. Hint: when geoSystem is UTM, xSpacing is number of eastings (meters).
attribute.name: xSpacing

attribute.tooltip: [zSpacing &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFDoubleLabel; "1.0"] (0,+∞) Distance between grid-array vertices along north-south Z direction. Hint: when geoSystem is GDC, zSpacing is number of degrees of latitude. Hint: when geoSystem is UTM, zSpacing is number of northings (meters).
attribute.name: zSpacing

attribute.tooltip: [yScale &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "1.0"] [0,+∞) Vertical exaggeration of displayed data produced from the height array.
attribute.name: yScale

attribute.tooltip: [height &initializeOnlyLabel; &MFDoubleLabel; "0 0 0 0"] Contains xDimension rows * zDimension columns floating-point values for elevation above ellipsoid. Hint: height array values are in row-major order from west to east, south to north. Hint: geoGridOrigin is in southwest (lower-left) corner of height dataset.
attribute.name: height

attribute.tooltip: [set_height &initializeOnlyLabel; &MFDoubleLabel; #FIXED ""] Contains xDimension rows * zDimension columns floating-point values for elevation above ellipsoid. Hint: height array values are in row-major order from west to east, south to north. Hint: geoGridOrigin is in southwest (lower-left) corner of height dataset. Warning: it is an error to define this transient inputOnly field in an X3D file, instead only use it a destination for ROUTE events.
attribute.name: set_height

attribute.tooltip: [ccw &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] ccw = sentido anti-horário: ordem da orientação das coordenadas dos vértices. Dica: ccw falso pode virar do avesso sólidos (backface culling) e a orientação dos vetores normais.
attribute.name: ccw

attribute.tooltip: [solid &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] Definindo solid verdadeiro significa desenhar somente as faces aparentes do polígono (backface culling on), definindo solid falso significa desenhar ambas as faces do polígono (backface culling off). Atenção: valores padrões verdadeiros podem esconder completamente a geometria se vistos pelo lado errado!
attribute.name: solid

attribute.tooltip: [creaseAngle &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFDoubleLabel; "0"] [0,infinito) O creaseAngle define o ângulo (em radianos) para determinar quais polígonos adjacentes serão desenhados com bordas bicudas ou suaves. Se o ângulo entre as normais de dois polígonos adjacentes é menor que o creaseAngle, um desenho suave é feito na linha que divide os poligonos. Dica: um creaseAngle=0 significa desenhar todos os polígonos com bordas bicudas, e um creaseAngle=3.14159 significa desenhar todas as bordas suaves. Hint: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Radian
attribute.name: creaseAngle

attribute.tooltip: [colorPerVertex &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] Se a cor deve ser aplicada por vértice (verdadeiro) ou por quadrilátero (falso). Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints, Color https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#Color
attribute.name: colorPerVertex

attribute.tooltip: [normalPerVertex &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] Se a normal deve ser aplicada por vértice (verdadeiro) ou por quadrilátero (falso). Hint: if no child Normal node is provided, the X3D browser shall automatically generate normals, using creaseAngle to determine smoothed shading across shared vertices.
attribute.name: normalPerVertex

attribute.tooltip: [containerField type NMTOKEN "geometry"] O containerField é um campo indicando a sua relação com o nó pai. Exemplos: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Shape. O atributo containerField é somente suportado em codificações XML de cenas X3D. Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints, containerField https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#containerField
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class type CDATA #IMPLIED] O atributo class é uma lista de classes separadas por espaços, reservada para o uso por XML stylesheets. O atributo class é somente suportado em codificações XML de cenas X3D.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: GeoLocation positions a regular X3D model onto earth's surface. GeoLocation can contain children and GeoOrigin nodes. Hint: X3D for Advanced Modeling (X3D4AM) slideset https://x3dgraphics.com/slidesets/X3dForAdvancedModeling/GeospatialComponentX3dEarth.pdf Warning: requires X3D profile='Full' or else include <component name='Geospatial' level='1'/> Warning: avoid having GeoLocation or GeoTransform as a parent or ancestor node of each other, since multiple geospatial transformations then occur with unpredictable results. Hint: GeoLocation adjusts orientation of children models appropriately: +Y axis is up direction for that local area (i.e. normal to tangent plane on the geospatial ellipsoid), -Z axis points towards north pole, and +X axis points east.
element.name: GeoLocation

attribute.tooltip: [DEF type ID #IMPLIED] DEF define uma identificação única para este nó, permitindo a outros nós o referenciá-lo. Dica: um DEF descritivo ajuda na clareza e na documentação. Hint: well-defined names can simplify design and debugging through improved author understanding. Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints, Naming Conventions https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#NamingConventions
attribute.name: DEF

attribute.tooltip: [USE type IDREF #IMPLIED] USE significa reusar um nó identificado por um DEF, ignorando _todos_ os outros atributos e filhos do nó. Dica: utilizando o USE para uma geometria (ao invés de duplica-la) pode melhorar o desempenho. Atenção: não inclua DEF (ou qualquer outro valor para um atributo) quando estiver usando o recurso do USE!
attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [geoSystem &initializeOnlyLabel; &GeoSystemType;] Identifies spatial reference frame: Geodetic (GD), Geocentric (GC), Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM). Supported values: "GD" "UTM" or "GC" followed by additional quoted string parameters as appropriate for the type. Hint: X3D Architecture 25.2.2 Spatial reference frames https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/geodata.html#Spatialreferenceframes Hint: X3D Architecture 25.2.4 Specifying geospatial coordinates https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/geodata.html#Specifyinggeospatialcoords Hint: UTM is Universal Transverse Mercator coordinate system https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universal_Transverse_Mercator_coordinate_system Warning: deprecated values are GDC (replaced by GD) and GCC (replaced by GC).
attribute.name: geoSystem

attribute.tooltip: [geoCoords &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec3dLabel; "0 0 0"] Geographic location (specified in current geoSystem coordinates) for children geometry (specified in relative coordinate system, in meters). Hint: X3D for Advanced Modeling (X3D4AM) slideset https://x3dgraphics.com/slidesets/X3dForAdvancedModeling/GeospatialComponentX3dEarth.pdf Warning: requires X3D profile='Full' or else include <component name='Geospatial' level='1'/>
attribute.name: geoCoords

attribute.tooltip: [bboxCenter &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"] Centro do cubo limitante : deslocamento da posição original do sistema de coordenadas. Hint: precomputation and inclusion of bounding box information can speed up the initialization of large detailed models, with a corresponding cost of increased file size. Hint: X3D Architecture, 10.2.2 Bounding boxes https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/group.html#BoundingBoxes
attribute.name: bboxCenter

attribute.tooltip: [bboxSize &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "-1 -1 -1"] Tamanho do cubo limitante : automaticamente calculado, pode ser especificado para uma otimização ou limitação. Hint: precomputation and inclusion of bounding box information can speed up the initialization of large detailed models, with a corresponding cost of increased file size. Hint: X3D Architecture, 10.2.2 Bounding boxes https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/group.html#BoundingBoxes
attribute.name: bboxSize

attribute.tooltip: [containerField type NMTOKEN "children"] O containerField é um campo indicando a sua relação com o nó pai. Exemplos: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Shape. O atributo containerField é somente suportado em codificações XML de cenas X3D. Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints, containerField https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#containerField
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class type CDATA #IMPLIED] O atributo class é uma lista de classes separadas por espaços, reservada para o uso por XML stylesheets. O atributo class é somente suportado em codificações XML de cenas X3D.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: GeoLOD provides quadtree level-of-detail loading/unloading for multi-resolution terrains. GeoLOD can contain children and GeoOrigin nodes. Dica: children nodes expose the scene graph for the currently loaded set of nodes. Dica: rootNode specifies the geometry of the root tile. Atenção: do not use rootUrl and rootNode simultaneously, since each specifies the root tile. Hint: X3D for Advanced Modeling (X3D4AM) slideset https://x3dgraphics.com/slidesets/X3dForAdvancedModeling/GeospatialComponentX3dEarth.pdf Warning: requires X3D profile='Full' or else include <component name='Geospatial' level='1'/> Warning: nested LOD (and/or GeoLOD) nodes with overlapping range intervals can lead to unexpected or undefined behavior.
element.name: GeoLOD

attribute.tooltip: [DEF type ID #IMPLIED] DEF define uma identificação única para este nó, permitindo a outros nós o referenciá-lo. Dica: um DEF descritivo ajuda na clareza e na documentação. Hint: well-defined names can simplify design and debugging through improved author understanding. Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints, Naming Conventions https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#NamingConventions
attribute.name: DEF

attribute.tooltip: [USE type IDREF #IMPLIED] USE significa reusar um nó identificado por um DEF, ignorando _todos_ os outros atributos e filhos do nó. Dica: utilizando o USE para uma geometria (ao invés de duplica-la) pode melhorar o desempenho. Atenção: não inclua DEF (ou qualquer outro valor para um atributo) quando estiver usando o recurso do USE!
attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [geoSystem &initializeOnlyLabel; &GeoSystemType;] Identifies spatial reference frame: Geodetic (GD), Geocentric (GC), Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM). Supported values: "GD" "UTM" or "GC" followed by additional quoted string parameters as appropriate for the type. Hint: X3D Architecture 25.2.2 Spatial reference frames https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/geodata.html#Spatialreferenceframes Hint: X3D Architecture 25.2.4 Specifying geospatial coordinates https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/geodata.html#Specifyinggeospatialcoords Hint: UTM is Universal Transverse Mercator coordinate system https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universal_Transverse_Mercator_coordinate_system Warning: deprecated values are GDC (replaced by GD) and GCC (replaced by GC).
attribute.name: geoSystem

attribute.tooltip: [rootUrl &initializeOnlyLabel; &MFStringLabel; #IMPLIED] url for scene providing geometry for the root tile. Warning: either rootNode or rootUrl can specify root tile, but specifying both is an error.
attribute.name: rootUrl

attribute.tooltip: [child1Url &initializeOnlyLabel; &MFStringLabel; #IMPLIED] quadtree geometry loaded when viewer is within range.
attribute.name: child1Url

attribute.tooltip: [child2Url &initializeOnlyLabel; &MFStringLabel; #IMPLIED] quadtree geometry loaded when viewer is within range.
attribute.name: child2Url

attribute.tooltip: [child3Url &initializeOnlyLabel; &MFStringLabel; #IMPLIED] quadtree geometry loaded when viewer is within range.
attribute.name: child3Url

attribute.tooltip: [child4Url &initializeOnlyLabel; &MFStringLabel; #IMPLIED] quadtree geometry loaded when viewer is within range.
attribute.name: child4Url

attribute.tooltip: [range &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFFloatLabel; #IMPLIED] (0,infinito) Viewer range from geographic-coordinates center triggers quadtree loading/unloading. Hint: not setting range values indicates that level switching can be optimized automatically based on performance.
attribute.name: range

attribute.tooltip: [center &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFVec3dLabel; "0 0 0"] Viewer range from geographic-coordinates center triggers quadtree loading/unloading.
attribute.name: center

attribute.tooltip: [bboxCenter &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"] Centro do cubo limitante : deslocamento da posição original do sistema de coordenadas. Hint: precomputation and inclusion of bounding box information can speed up the initialization of large detailed models, with a corresponding cost of increased file size. Hint: X3D Architecture, 10.2.2 Bounding boxes https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/group.html#BoundingBoxes
attribute.name: bboxCenter

attribute.tooltip: [bboxSize &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "-1 -1 -1"] Tamanho do cubo limitante : automaticamente calculado, pode ser especificado para uma otimização ou limitação. Hint: precomputation and inclusion of bounding box information can speed up the initialization of large detailed models, with a corresponding cost of increased file size. Hint: X3D Architecture, 10.2.2 Bounding boxes https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/group.html#BoundingBoxes
attribute.name: bboxSize

attribute.tooltip: [containerField type NMTOKEN "children"] O containerField é um campo indicando a sua relação com o nó pai. Exemplos: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Shape. O atributo containerField é somente suportado em codificações XML de cenas X3D. Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints, containerField https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#containerField
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class type CDATA #IMPLIED] O atributo class é uma lista de classes separadas por espaços, reservada para o uso por XML stylesheets. O atributo class é somente suportado em codificações XML de cenas X3D.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: GeoMetadata includes a generic subset of metadata about the geographic data. Hint: X3D for Advanced Modeling (X3D4AM) slideset https://x3dgraphics.com/slidesets/X3dForAdvancedModeling/GeospatialComponentX3dEarth.pdf Warning: requires X3D profile='Full' or else include <component name='Geospatial' level='1'/> Hint: apply containerField='watchList' when parent node is LoadSensor.
element.name: GeoMetadata

attribute.tooltip: [DEF type ID #IMPLIED] DEF define uma identificação única para este nó, permitindo a outros nós o referenciá-lo. Dica: um DEF descritivo ajuda na clareza e na documentação. Hint: well-defined names can simplify design and debugging through improved author understanding. Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints, Naming Conventions https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#NamingConventions
attribute.name: DEF

attribute.tooltip: [USE type IDREF #IMPLIED] USE significa reusar um nó identificado por um DEF, ignorando _todos_ os outros atributos e filhos do nó. Dica: utilizando o USE para uma geometria (ao invés de duplica-la) pode melhorar o desempenho. Atenção: não inclua DEF (ou qualquer outro valor para um atributo) quando estiver usando o recurso do USE!
attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [url &inputOutputLabel; &MFStringLabel; #IMPLIED] Hypertext link to an external, complete metadata description. Dica: Textos podem conter múltiplos valores, então separe cada texto usando aspas "https://www.web3d.org" "https://www.web3d.org/about" "etc." Dica: A codificação para " é " (uma entidade de caractere). Atenção: Os nomes de diretórios e arquivos devem respeitar maiúsculas e minúsculas para ligações http! Dica: Você pode substituir espaços em branco em endereços url por %20 para cada espaço. Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints, urls https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#urls
attribute.name: url

attribute.tooltip: [data &inputOutputLabel; IDREFS #IMPLIED] DEF list of all nodes that implement this data. If no specific geospatial nodes identified, then this GeoMetadata node pertains to entire scene.
attribute.name: data

attribute.tooltip: [summary &inputOutputLabel; &MFStringLabel; #IMPLIED] The summary string array contains a set of keyword/value pairs, with each keyword and its subsequent value contained in separate strings. Hint: example <GeoMetadata summary=' "title" "San Francisco, California USA" '/>. Hint: Table 25.5, GeoMetadata keywords and values https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/geodata.html#t-keywordsandvaluesHint: there should always be an even (or zero) number of strings to match key-value pairs.
attribute.name: summary

attribute.tooltip: [containerField type NMTOKEN "children"] O containerField é um campo indicando a sua relação com o nó pai. Exemplos: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Shape. O atributo containerField é somente suportado em codificações XML de cenas X3D. Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints, containerField https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#containerField
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class type CDATA #IMPLIED] O atributo class é uma lista de classes separadas por espaços, reservada para o uso por XML stylesheets. O atributo class é somente suportado em codificações XML de cenas X3D.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: GeoOrigin specifies local geospatial coordinate system for parent node, enabling increased geographic precision during scene rendering (by mitigating potential floating-point roundoff errors). GeoOrigin can be contained by other Geospatial component nodes, typically via DEF/USE to ensure consistency. Dica: only one geospatial coordinate system is allowed per scene, thus DEF-ing and later USE-ing only one GeoOrigin node per scene is recommended. Hint: X3D for Advanced Modeling (X3D4AM) slideset https://x3dgraphics.com/slidesets/X3dForAdvancedModeling/GeospatialComponentX3dEarth.pdf Warning: requires X3D profile='Full' or else include <component name='Geospatial' level='1'/> Warning: GeoOrigin is deprecated, discouraged and not legal in X3D v3.3. GeoOrigin can be ignored in X3D v3.2 and below. Hint: GeoOrigin is likely to be restored in X3D v4.0 for special use on devices with limited floating-point resolution.
element.name: GeoOrigin

attribute.tooltip: [DEF type ID #IMPLIED] DEF define uma identificação única para este nó, permitindo a outros nós o referenciá-lo. Dica: um DEF descritivo ajuda na clareza e na documentação. Hint: well-defined names can simplify design and debugging through improved author understanding. Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints, Naming Conventions https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#NamingConventions
attribute.name: DEF

attribute.tooltip: [USE type IDREF #IMPLIED] USE significa reusar um nó identificado por um DEF, ignorando _todos_ os outros atributos e filhos do nó. Dica: utilizando o USE para uma geometria (ao invés de duplica-la) pode melhorar o desempenho. Atenção: não inclua DEF (ou qualquer outro valor para um atributo) quando estiver usando o recurso do USE!
attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [geoSystem &initializeOnlyLabel; &GeoSystemType;] Identifies spatial reference frame: Geodetic (GD), Geocentric (GC), Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM). Supported values: "GD" "UTM" or "GC" followed by additional quoted string parameters as appropriate for the type. Hint: X3D Architecture 25.2.2 Spatial reference frames https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/geodata.html#Spatialreferenceframes Hint: X3D Architecture 25.2.4 Specifying geospatial coordinates https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/geodata.html#Specifyinggeospatialcoords Hint: UTM is Universal Transverse Mercator coordinate system https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universal_Transverse_Mercator_coordinate_system Warning: deprecated values are GDC (replaced by GD) and GCC (replaced by GC).

attribute.tooltip: [geoCoords &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec3dLabel; "0 0 0"] Defines absolute geographic location (and implicit local coordinate frame). Hint: X3D for Advanced Modeling (X3D4AM) slideset https://x3dgraphics.com/slidesets/X3dForAdvancedModeling/GeospatialComponentX3dEarth.pdf Warning: requires X3D profile='Full' or else include <component name='Geospatial' level='1'/>
attribute.name: geoCoords

attribute.tooltip: [rotateYUp &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "false"] Whether to rotate coordinates of nodes using this GeoOrigin so that local-up direction aligns with VRML Y axis rotateYUp false means local up-direction is relative to planet surface rotateYUp true allows proper operation of NavigationInfo modes FLY, WALK.
attribute.name: rotateYUp

attribute.tooltip: [containerField type NMTOKEN "geoOrigin"] O containerField é um campo indicando a sua relação com o nó pai. Exemplos: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Shape. O atributo containerField é somente suportado em codificações XML de cenas X3D. Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints, containerField https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#containerField

attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: GeoPositionInterpolator animates objects within a geographic coordinate system. GeoPositionInterpolator can contain a GeoOrigin node. Entrada típica: ROUTE someTimeSensorDEF.fraction_changed TO someInterpolatorDEF.set_fraction Saída típica: ROUTE someInterpolatorDEF.value_changed TO destinationNode.set_attribute. Hint: X3D for Advanced Modeling (X3D4AM) slideset https://x3dgraphics.com/slidesets/X3dForAdvancedModeling/GeospatialComponentX3dEarth.pdf Warning: requires X3D profile='Full' or else include <component name='Geospatial' level='1'/>
element.name: GeoPositionInterpolator
